title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. A, ch. I, subch. C, pt. 130 - Costs And Sanctions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. A, ch. I, subch. C, pt. 130 - Costs And Sanctions

State Regulations
ยง 130.1 - Renumbered

Subpart 130-1 - Awards of Costs and Imposition of Financial Sanctions for Frivolous Conduct in Civil Litigation (ยง 130-1.1 to 130-1.5)

Subpart 130-2 - Imposition of Financial Sanctions or Costs for Unjustified Failure to Attend a Scheduled Court Appearance (ยง 130-2.1 to 130-2.4)

The powers of a court set forth in this

Subpart shall apply to judges of the housing part of the New York Civil Court, support magistrates appointed pursuant to section
439
of the

Family Court Act, and judicial support magistrates, except that: (a) the powers of the Family

Court support magistrates shall be limited to a determination that an attorney, without good cause, has failed to appear at a time and place scheduled for a

Family Court proceeding, which shall be subject to confirmation by a judge of
the Family Court who may impose any sanctions authorized by this Subpart; and
(b) the powers
of judicial hearing officers shall be limited to civil cases. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. A, ch. I, subch. C, pt. 130

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
